00031 #include "node_composite_util.h"

00035 static bNodeSocketTemplate cmp_node_doubleedgemask_in[]= {
00036     { SOCK_FLOAT, 1, "Inner Mask", 0.8f, 0.8f, 0.8f, 1.0f, 0.0f, 1.0f, PROP_NONE},  // inner mask socket definition
00037     { SOCK_FLOAT, 1, "Outer Mask", 0.8f, 0.8f, 0.8f, 1.0f, 0.0f, 1.0f, PROP_NONE},  // outer mask socket definition
00038     { -1, 0, "" }                                                                   // input socket array terminator
00039 };
00040 static bNodeSocketTemplate cmp_node_doubleedgemask_out[]= {
00041     { SOCK_FLOAT, 0, "Mask"},       // output socket definition
00042     { -1, 0, "" }                   // output socket array terminator
00043 };
00044 
00045 static void do_adjacentKeepBorders(unsigned int t, unsigned int rw, unsigned int *limask, unsigned int *lomask, unsigned int *lres, float *res, unsigned int *rsize)
00046 {
00047     int x;
00048     unsigned int isz=0; // inner edge size
00049     unsigned int osz=0; // outer edge size
00050     unsigned int gsz=0; // gradient fill area size
00051     /* Test the four corners */
00052     /* upper left corner */
00053     x=t-rw+1;
00054     // test if inner mask is filled
00055     if (limask[x]) {
00056         // test if pixel underneath, or to the right, are empty in the inner mask,
00057         // but filled in the outer mask
00058         if ((!limask[x-rw] && lomask[x-rw]) || (!limask[x+1] && lomask[x+1])) {
00059             isz++;                              // increment inner edge size
00060             lres[x]=4;                          // flag pixel as inner edge
00061         }
00062         else {
00063             res[x]=1.0f;                        // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00064         }
00065     }
00066     else if (lomask[x]) {                       // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00067         osz++;                                  // increment outer edge size
00068         lres[x]=3;                              // flag pixel as outer edge
00069     }
00070     /* upper right corner */
00071     x=t;
00072     // test if inner mask is filled
00073     if (limask[x]) {
00074         // test if pixel underneath, or to the left, are empty in the inner mask,
00075         // but filled in the outer mask
00076         if ((!limask[x-rw] && lomask[x-rw]) || (!limask[x-1] && lomask[x-1])) {
00077             isz++;                              // increment inner edge size
00078             lres[x]=4;                          // flag pixel as inner edge
00079         }
00080         else {
00081             res[x]=1.0f;                        // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00082         }
00083     }
00084     else if (lomask[x]) {                       // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00085         osz++;                                  // increment outer edge size
00086         lres[x]=3;                              // flag pixel as outer edge
00087     }
00088     /* lower left corner */
00089     x=0;
00090     // test if inner mask is filled
00091     if (limask[x]) {
00092         // test if pixel above, or to the right, are empty in the inner mask,
00093         // but filled in the outer mask
00094         if ((!limask[x+rw] && lomask[x+rw]) || (!limask[x+1] && lomask[x+1])) {
00095             isz++;                              // increment inner edge size
00096             lres[x]=4;                          // flag pixel as inner edge
00097         }
00098         else {
00099             res[x]=1.0f;                        // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00100         }
00101     }
00102     else if (lomask[x]) {                       // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00103         osz++;                                  // increment outer edge size
00104         lres[x]=3;                              // flag pixel as outer edge
00105     }
00106     /* lower right corner */
00107     x=rw-1;
00108     // test if inner mask is filled
00109     if (limask[x]) {
00110         // test if pixel above, or to the left, are empty in the inner mask,
00111         // but filled in the outer mask
00112         if ((!limask[x+rw] && lomask[x+rw]) || (!limask[x-1] && lomask[x-1])) {
00113             isz++;                              // increment inner edge size
00114             lres[x]=4;                          // flag pixel as inner edge
00115         }
00116         else {
00117             res[x]=1.0f;                        // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00118         }
00119     }
00120     else if (lomask[x]) {                       // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00121         osz++;                                  // increment outer edge size
00122         lres[x]=3;                              // flag pixel as outer edge
00123     }
00124 
00125     /* Test the TOP row of pixels in buffer, except corners */
00126     for (x= t-1; x>=(t-rw)+2; x--) {
00127         // test if inner mask is filled
00128         if (limask[x]) {
00129             // test if pixel to the right, or to the left, are empty in the inner mask,
00130             // but filled in the outer mask
00131             if ((!limask[x-1] && lomask[x-1]) || (!limask[x+1] && lomask[x+1])) {
00132                 isz++;                          // increment inner edge size
00133                 lres[x]=4;                      // flag pixel as inner edge
00134             }
00135             else {
00136                 res[x]=1.0f;                    // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00137             }
00138         }
00139         else if (lomask[x]) {                   // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00140             osz++;                              // increment outer edge size
00141             lres[x]=3;                          // flag pixel as outer edge
00142         }
00143     }
00144 
00145     /* Test the BOTTOM row of pixels in buffer, except corners */
00146     for (x= rw-2; x; x--) {
00147         // test if inner mask is filled
00148         if (limask[x]) {
00149             // test if pixel to the right, or to the left, are empty in the inner mask,
00150             // but filled in the outer mask
00151             if ((!limask[x-1] && lomask[x-1]) || (!limask[x+1] && lomask[x+1])) {
00152                 isz++;                          // increment inner edge size
00153                 lres[x]=4;                      // flag pixel as inner edge
00154             }
00155             else {
00156                 res[x]=1.0f;                    // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00157             }
00158         }
00159         else if (lomask[x]) {                   // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00160             osz++;                              // increment outer edge size
00161             lres[x]=3;                          // flag pixel as outer edge
00162         }
00163     }
00164     /* Test the LEFT edge of pixels in buffer, except corners */
00165     for (x= t-(rw<<1)+1; x>=rw; x-=rw) {
00166         // test if inner mask is filled
00167         if (limask[x]) {
00168             // test if pixel underneath, or above, are empty in the inner mask,
00169             // but filled in the outer mask
00170             if ((!limask[x-rw] && lomask[x-rw]) || (!limask[x+rw] && lomask[x+rw])) {
00171                 isz++;                          // increment inner edge size
00172                 lres[x]=4;                      // flag pixel as inner edge
00173             }
00174             else {
00175                 res[x]=1.0f;                    // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00176             }
00177         }
00178         else if (lomask[x]) {                   // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00179             osz++;                              // increment outer edge size
00180             lres[x]=3;                          // flag pixel as outer edge
00181         }
00182     }
00183 
00184     /* Test the RIGHT edge of pixels in buffer, except corners */
00185     for (x= t-rw; x>rw; x-=rw) {
00186         // test if inner mask is filled
00187         if (limask[x]) {
00188             // test if pixel underneath, or above, are empty in the inner mask,
00189             // but filled in the outer mask
00190             if ((!limask[x-rw] && lomask[x-rw]) || (!limask[x+rw] && lomask[x+rw])) {
00191                 isz++;                          // increment inner edge size
00192                 lres[x]=4;                      // flag pixel as inner edge
00193             }
00194             else {
00195                 res[x]=1.0f;                    // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00196             }
00197         }
00198         else if (lomask[x]) {                   // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00199             osz++;                              // increment outer edge size
00200             lres[x]=3;                          // flag pixel as outer edge
00201         }
00202     }
00203 
00204     rsize[0]=isz; // fill in our return sizes for edges + fill
00205     rsize[1]=osz;
00206     rsize[2]=gsz;
00207 }
00208 
00209 static void do_adjacentBleedBorders(unsigned int t, unsigned int rw, unsigned int *limask, unsigned int *lomask, unsigned int *lres, float *res, unsigned int *rsize)
00210 {
00211     int x;
00212     unsigned int isz=0; // inner edge size
00213     unsigned int osz=0; // outer edge size
00214     unsigned int gsz=0; // gradient fill area size
00215     /* Test the four corners */
00216     /* upper left corner */
00217     x=t-rw+1;
00218     // test if inner mask is filled
00219     if (limask[x]) {
00220         // test if pixel underneath, or to the right, are empty in the inner mask,
00221         // but filled in the outer mask
00222         if ((!limask[x-rw] && lomask[x-rw]) || (!limask[x+1] && lomask[x+1])) {
00223             isz++;                              // increment inner edge size
00224             lres[x]=4;                          // flag pixel as inner edge
00225         }
00226         else {
00227             res[x]=1.0f;                        // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00228         }
00229     }
00230     else if (lomask[x]) {                       // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00231         if (!lomask[x-rw] || !lomask[x+1]) {        // test if outer mask is empty underneath or to the right
00232             osz++;                              // increment outer edge size
00233             lres[x]=3;                          // flag pixel as outer edge
00234         }
00235         else {
00236             gsz++;                              // increment the gradient pixel count
00237             lres[x]=2;                          // flag pixel as gradient
00238         }
00239     }
00240     /* upper right corner */
00241     x=t;
00242     // test if inner mask is filled
00243     if (limask[x]) {
00244         // test if pixel underneath, or to the left, are empty in the inner mask,
00245         // but filled in the outer mask
00246         if ((!limask[x-rw] && lomask[x-rw]) || (!limask[x-1] && lomask[x-1])) {
00247             isz++;                              // increment inner edge size
00248             lres[x]=4;                          // flag pixel as inner edge
00249         }
00250         else {
00251             res[x]=1.0f;                        // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00252         }
00253     }
00254     else if (lomask[x]) {                       // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00255         if (!lomask[x-rw] || !lomask[x-1]) {    // test if outer mask is empty underneath or to the left
00256             osz++;                              // increment outer edge size
00257             lres[x]=3;                          // flag pixel as outer edge
00258         }
00259         else {
00260             gsz++;                              // increment the gradient pixel count
00261             lres[x]=2;                          // flag pixel as gradient
00262         }
00263     }
00264     /* lower left corner */
00265     x=0;
00266     // test if inner mask is filled
00267     if (limask[x]) {
00268         // test if pixel above, or to the right, are empty in the inner mask,
00269         // but filled in the outer mask
00270         if ((!limask[x+rw] && lomask[x+rw]) || (!limask[x+1] && lomask[x+1])) {
00271             isz++;                              // increment inner edge size
00272             lres[x]=4;                          // flag pixel as inner edge
00273         }
00274         else {
00275             res[x]=1.0f;                        // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00276         }
00277     }
00278     else if (lomask[x]) {                       // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00279         if (!lomask[x+rw] || !lomask[x+1]) {    // test if outer mask is empty above or to the right
00280             osz++;                              // increment outer edge size
00281             lres[x]=3;                          // flag pixel as outer edge
00282         }
00283         else {
00284             gsz++;                              // increment the gradient pixel count
00285             lres[x]=2;                          // flag pixel as gradient
00286         }
00287     }
00288     /* lower right corner */
00289     x=rw-1;
00290     // test if inner mask is filled
00291     if (limask[x]) {
00292         // test if pixel above, or to the left, are empty in the inner mask,
00293         // but filled in the outer mask
00294         if ((!limask[x+rw] && lomask[x+rw]) || (!limask[x-1] && lomask[x-1])) {
00295             isz++;                              // increment inner edge size
00296             lres[x]=4;                          // flag pixel as inner edge
00297         }
00298         else {
00299             res[x]=1.0f;                        // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00300         }
00301     }
00302     else if (lomask[x]) {                       // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00303         if (!lomask[x+rw] || !lomask[x-1]) {    // test if outer mask is empty above or to the left
00304             osz++;                              // increment outer edge size
00305             lres[x]=3;                          // flag pixel as outer edge
00306         }
00307         else {
00308             gsz++;                              // increment the gradient pixel count
00309             lres[x]=2;                          // flag pixel as gradient
00310         }
00311     }
00312     /* Test the TOP row of pixels in buffer, except corners */
00313     for (x= t-1; x>=(t-rw)+2; x--) {
00314         // test if inner mask is filled
00315         if (limask[x]) {
00316             // test if pixel to the left, or to the right, are empty in the inner mask,
00317             // but filled in the outer mask
00318             if ((!limask[x-1] && lomask[x-1]) || (!limask[x+1] && lomask[x+1])) {
00319                 isz++;                          // increment inner edge size
00320                 lres[x]=4;                      // flag pixel as inner edge
00321             }
00322             else {
00323                 res[x]=1.0f;                    // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00324             }
00325         }
00326         else if (lomask[x]) {                   // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00327             if (!lomask[x-1] || !lomask[x+1]) { // test if outer mask is empty to the left or to the right
00328                 osz++;                          // increment outer edge size
00329                 lres[x]=3;                      // flag pixel as outer edge
00330             }
00331             else {
00332                 gsz++;                          // increment the gradient pixel count
00333                 lres[x]=2;                      // flag pixel as gradient
00334             }
00335         }
00336     }
00337 
00338     /* Test the BOTTOM row of pixels in buffer, except corners */
00339     for (x= rw-2; x; x--) {
00340         // test if inner mask is filled
00341         if (limask[x]) {
00342             // test if pixel to the left, or to the right, are empty in the inner mask,
00343             // but filled in the outer mask
00344             if ((!limask[x-1] && lomask[x-1]) || (!limask[x+1] && lomask[x+1])) {
00345                 isz++;                          // increment inner edge size
00346                 lres[x]=4;                      // flag pixel as inner edge
00347             }
00348             else {
00349                 res[x]=1.0f;                    // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00350             }
00351         }
00352         else if (lomask[x]) {                   // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00353             if (!lomask[x-1] || !lomask[x+1]) { // test if outer mask is empty to the left or to the right
00354                 osz++;                          // increment outer edge size
00355                 lres[x]=3;                      // flag pixel as outer edge
00356             }
00357             else {
00358                 gsz++;                          // increment the gradient pixel count
00359                 lres[x]=2;                      // flag pixel as gradient
00360             }
00361         }
00362     }
00363     /* Test the LEFT edge of pixels in buffer, except corners */
00364     for (x= t-(rw<<1)+1; x>=rw; x-=rw) {
00365         // test if inner mask is filled
00366         if (limask[x]) {
00367             // test if pixel underneath, or above, are empty in the inner mask,
00368             // but filled in the outer mask
00369             if ((!limask[x-rw] && lomask[x-rw]) || (!limask[x+rw] && lomask[x+rw])) {
00370                 isz++;                          // increment inner edge size
00371                 lres[x]=4;                      // flag pixel as inner edge
00372             }
00373             else {
00374                 res[x]=1.0f;                    // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00375             }
00376         }
00377         else if (lomask[x]) {                       // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00378             if (!lomask[x-rw] || !lomask[x+rw]) {   // test if outer mask is empty underneath or above
00379                 osz++;                              // increment outer edge size
00380                 lres[x]=3;                          // flag pixel as outer edge
00381             }
00382             else {
00383                 gsz++;                          // increment the gradient pixel count
00384                 lres[x]=2;                      // flag pixel as gradient
00385             }
00386         }
00387     }
00388 
00389     /* Test the RIGHT edge of pixels in buffer, except corners */
00390     for (x= t-rw; x>rw; x-=rw) {
00391         // test if inner mask is filled
00392         if (limask[x]) {
00393             // test if pixel underneath, or above, are empty in the inner mask,
00394             // but filled in the outer mask
00395             if ((!limask[x-rw] && lomask[x-rw]) || (!limask[x+rw] && lomask[x+rw])) {
00396                 isz++;                          // increment inner edge size
00397                 lres[x]=4;                      // flag pixel as inner edge
00398             }
00399             else {
00400                 res[x]=1.0f;                    // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00401             }
00402         }
00403         else if (lomask[x]) {                       // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00404             if (!lomask[x-rw] || !lomask[x+rw]) {   // test if outer mask is empty underneath or above
00405                 osz++;                              // increment outer edge size

00407             }

00409                 gsz++;                          // increment the gradient pixel count

00411             }
00412         }
00413     }
00414

00419 
00420 static void do_allKeepBorders(unsigned int t, unsigned int rw, unsigned int *limask, unsigned int *lomask, unsigned int *lres, float *res, unsigned int *rsize)
00421 {
00422     int x;
00423     unsigned int isz=0; // inner edge size
00424     unsigned int osz=0; // outer edge size
00425     unsigned int gsz=0; // gradient fill area size
00426     /* Test the four corners */
00427     /* upper left corner */
00428     x=t-rw+1;
00429     // test if inner mask is filled
00430     if (limask[x]) {
00431         // test if the inner mask is empty underneath or to the right
00432         if (!limask[x-rw] || !limask[x+1]) {
00433             isz++;                              // increment inner edge size
00434             lres[x]=4;                          // flag pixel as inner edge
00435         }
00436         else {
00437             res[x]=1.0f;                        // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00438         }
00439     }
00440     else if (lomask[x]) {                       // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00441         osz++;                                  // increment outer edge size
00442         lres[x]=3;                              // flag pixel as outer edge
00443     }
00444     /* upper right corner */
00445     x=t;
00446     // test if inner mask is filled
00447     if (limask[x]) {
00448         // test if the inner mask is empty underneath or to the left
00449         if (!limask[x-rw] || !limask[x-1]) {
00450             isz++;                              // increment inner edge size
00451             lres[x]=4;                          // flag pixel as inner edge
00452         }
00453         else {
00454             res[x]=1.0f;                        // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00455         }
00456     }
00457     else if (lomask[x]) {                       // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00458         osz++;                                  // increment outer edge size
00459         lres[x]=3;                              // flag pixel as outer edge
00460     }
00461     /* lower left corner */
00462     x=0;
00463     // test if inner mask is filled
00464     if (limask[x]) {
00465         // test if inner mask is empty above or to the right
00466         if (!limask[x+rw] || !limask[x+1]) {
00467             isz++;                              // increment inner edge size
00468             lres[x]=4;                          // flag pixel as inner edge
00469         }
00470         else {
00471             res[x]=1.0f;                        // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00472         }
00473     }
00474     else if (lomask[x]) {                       // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00475         osz++;                                  // increment outer edge size
00476         lres[x]=3;                              // flag pixel as outer edge
00477     }
00478     /* lower right corner */
00479     x=rw-1;
00480     // test if inner mask is filled
00481     if (limask[x]) {
00482         // test if inner mask is empty above or to the left
00483         if (!limask[x+rw] || !limask[x-1]) {
00484             isz++;                              // increment inner edge size
00485             lres[x]=4;                          // flag pixel as inner edge
00486         }
00487         else {
00488             res[x]=1.0f;                        // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00489         }
00490     }
00491     else if (lomask[x]) {                       // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00492         osz++;                                  // increment outer edge size
00493         lres[x]=3;                              // flag pixel as outer edge
00494     }
00495 
00496     /* Test the TOP row of pixels in buffer, except corners */
00497     for (x= t-1; x>=(t-rw)+2; x--) {
00498         // test if inner mask is filled
00499         if (limask[x]) {
00500             // test if inner mask is empty to the left or to the right
00501             if (!limask[x-1] || !limask[x+1]) {
00502                 isz++;                          // increment inner edge size
00503                 lres[x]=4;                      // flag pixel as inner edge
00504             }
00505             else {
00506                 res[x]=1.0f;                    // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00507             }
00508         }
00509         else if (lomask[x]) {                   // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00510             osz++;                              // increment outer edge size
00511             lres[x]=3;                          // flag pixel as outer edge
00512         }
00513     }
00514 
00515     /* Test the BOTTOM row of pixels in buffer, except corners */
00516     for (x= rw-2; x; x--) {
00517         // test if inner mask is filled
00518         if (limask[x]) {
00519             // test if inner mask is empty to the left or to the right
00520             if (!limask[x-1] || !limask[x+1]) {
00521                 isz++;                          // increment inner edge size
00522                 lres[x]=4;                      // flag pixel as inner edge
00523             }
00524             else {
00525                 res[x]=1.0f;                    // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00526             }
00527         }
00528         else if (lomask[x]) {                   // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00529             osz++;                              // increment outer edge size
00530             lres[x]=3;                          // flag pixel as outer edge
00531         }
00532     }
00533     /* Test the LEFT edge of pixels in buffer, except corners */
00534     for (x= t-(rw<<1)+1; x>=rw; x-=rw) {
00535         // test if inner mask is filled
00536         if (limask[x]) {
00537             // test if inner mask is empty underneath or above
00538             if (!limask[x-rw] || !limask[x+rw]) {
00539                 isz++;                          // increment inner edge size
00540                 lres[x]=4;                      // flag pixel as inner edge
00541             }
00542             else {
00543                 res[x]=1.0f;                    // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00544             }
00545         }
00546         else if (lomask[x]) {                   // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00547             osz++;                              // increment outer edge size
00548             lres[x]=3;                          // flag pixel as outer edge
00549         }
00550     }
00551 
00552     /* Test the RIGHT edge of pixels in buffer, except corners */
00553     for (x= t-rw; x>rw; x-=rw) {
00554         // test if inner mask is filled
00555         if (limask[x]) {
00556             // test if inner mask is empty underneath or above
00557             if (!limask[x-rw] || !limask[x+rw]) {
00558                 isz++;                          // increment inner edge size
00559                 lres[x]=4;                      // flag pixel as inner edge
00560             }
00561             else {
00562                 res[x]=1.0f;                    // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00563             }
00564         }
00565         else if (lomask[x]) {                   // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00566             osz++;                              // increment outer edge size
00567             lres[x]=3;                          // flag pixel as outer edge
00568         }
00569     }
00570 
00571     rsize[0]=isz;  // fill in our return sizes for edges + fill
00572     rsize[1]=osz;
00573     rsize[2]=gsz;
00574 }
00575 
00576 static void do_allBleedBorders(unsigned int t, unsigned int rw, unsigned int *limask, unsigned int *lomask, unsigned int *lres, float *res, unsigned int *rsize)
00577 {
00578     int x;
00579     unsigned int isz=0; // inner edge size
00580     unsigned int osz=0; // outer edge size
00581     unsigned int gsz=0; // gradient fill area size
00582     /* Test the four corners */
00583     /* upper left corner */
00584     x=t-rw+1;
00585     // test if inner mask is filled
00586     if (limask[x]) {
00587         // test if the inner mask is empty underneath or to the right
00588         if (!limask[x-rw] || !limask[x+1]) {
00589             isz++;                              // increment inner edge size
00590             lres[x]=4;                          // flag pixel as inner edge
00591         }
00592         else {
00593             res[x]=1.0f;                        // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00594         }
00595     }
00596     else if (lomask[x]) {                       // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00597         if (!lomask[x-rw] || !lomask[x+1]) {    // test if outer mask is empty underneath or to the right
00598             osz++;                              // increment outer edge size
00599             lres[x]=3;                          // flag pixel as outer edge
00600         }
00601         else {
00602             gsz++;                              // increment the gradient pixel count
00603             lres[x]=2;                          // flag pixel as gradient
00604         }
00605     }
00606     /* upper right corner */
00607     x=t;
00608     // test if inner mask is filled
00609     if (limask[x]) {
00610         // test if the inner mask is empty underneath or to the left
00611         if (!limask[x-rw] || !limask[x-1]) {
00612             isz++;                              // increment inner edge size
00613             lres[x]=4;                          // flag pixel as inner edge
00614         }
00615         else {
00616             res[x]=1.0f;                        // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00617         }
00618     }
00619     else if (lomask[x]) {                       // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00620         if (!lomask[x-rw] || !lomask[x-1]) {        // test if outer mask is empty above or to the left
00621             osz++;                              // increment outer edge size
00622             lres[x]=3;                          // flag pixel as outer edge
00623         }
00624         else {
00625             gsz++;                              // increment the gradient pixel count
00626             lres[x]=2;                          // flag pixel as gradient
00627         }
00628     }
00629     /* lower left corner */
00630     x=0;
00631     // test if inner mask is filled
00632     if (limask[x]) {
00633         // test if inner mask is empty above or to the right
00634         if (!limask[x+rw] || !limask[x+1]) {
00635             isz++;                              // increment inner edge size
00636             lres[x]=4;                          // flag pixel as inner edge
00637         }
00638         else {
00639             res[x]=1.0f;                        // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00640         }
00641     }
00642     else if (lomask[x]) {                       // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00643         if (!lomask[x+rw] || !lomask[x+1]) {    // test if outer mask is empty underneath or to the right
00644             osz++;                              // increment outer edge size
00645             lres[x]=3;                          // flag pixel as outer edge
00646         }
00647         else {
00648             gsz++;                              // increment the gradient pixel count
00649             lres[x]=2;                          // flag pixel as gradient
00650         }
00651     }
00652     /* lower right corner */
00653     x=rw-1;
00654     // test if inner mask is filled
00655     if (limask[x]) {
00656         // test if inner mask is empty above or to the left
00657         if (!limask[x+rw] || !limask[x-1]) {
00658             isz++;                              // increment inner edge size
00659             lres[x]=4;                          // flag pixel as inner edge
00660         }
00661         else {
00662             res[x]=1.0f;                        // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00663         }
00664     }
00665     else if (lomask[x]) {                       // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00666         if (!lomask[x+rw] || !lomask[x-1]) {    // test if outer mask is empty underneath or to the left
00667             osz++;                              // increment outer edge size
00668             lres[x]=3;                          // flag pixel as outer edge
00669         }
00670         else {
00671             gsz++;                              // increment the gradient pixel count
00672             lres[x]=2;                          // flag pixel as gradient
00673         }
00674     }
00675     /* Test the TOP row of pixels in buffer, except corners */
00676     for (x= t-1; x>=(t-rw)+2; x--) {
00677         // test if inner mask is filled
00678         if (limask[x]) {
00679             // test if inner mask is empty to the left or to the right
00680             if (!limask[x-1] || !limask[x+1]) {
00681                 isz++;                          // increment inner edge size
00682                 lres[x]=4;                      // flag pixel as inner edge
00683             }
00684             else {
00685                 res[x]=1.0f;                    // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00686             }
00687         }
00688         else if (lomask[x]) {                   // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00689             if (!lomask[x-1] || !lomask[x+1]) { // test if outer mask is empty to the left or to the right
00690                 osz++;                          // increment outer edge size
00691                 lres[x]=3;                      // flag pixel as outer edge
00692             }
00693             else {
00694                 gsz++;                          // increment the gradient pixel count
00695                 lres[x]=2;                      // flag pixel as gradient
00696             }
00697         }
00698     }
00699 
00700     /* Test the BOTTOM row of pixels in buffer, except corners */
00701     for (x= rw-2; x; x--) {
00702         // test if inner mask is filled
00703         if (limask[x]) {
00704             // test if inner mask is empty to the left or to the right
00705             if (!limask[x-1] || !limask[x+1]) {
00706                 isz++;                          // increment inner edge size
00707                 lres[x]=4;                      // flag pixel as inner edge
00708             }
00709             else {
00710                 res[x]=1.0f;                    // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00711             }
00712         }
00713         else if (lomask[x]) {                   // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00714             if (!lomask[x-1] || !lomask[x+1]) { // test if outer mask is empty to the left or to the right
00715                 osz++;                          // increment outer edge size
00716                 lres[x]=3;                      // flag pixel as outer edge
00717             }
00718             else {
00719                 gsz++;                          // increment the gradient pixel count
00720                 lres[x]=2;                      // flag pixel as gradient
00721             }
00722         }
00723     }
00724     /* Test the LEFT edge of pixels in buffer, except corners */
00725     for (x= t-(rw<<1)+1; x>=rw; x-=rw) {
00726         // test if inner mask is filled
00727         if (limask[x]) {
00728             // test if inner mask is empty underneath or above
00729             if (!limask[x-rw] || !limask[x+rw]) {
00730                 isz++;                              // increment inner edge size
00731                 lres[x]=4;                          // flag pixel as inner edge
00732             }
00733             else {
00734                 res[x]=1.0f;                        // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00735             }
00736         }
00737         else if (lomask[x]) {                       // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00738             if (!lomask[x-rw] || !lomask[x+rw]) {   // test if outer mask is empty underneath or above
00739                 osz++;                              // increment outer edge size
00740                 lres[x]=3;                          // flag pixel as outer edge
00741             }
00742             else {
00743                 gsz++;                              // increment the gradient pixel count
00744                 lres[x]=2;                          // flag pixel as gradient
00745             }
00746         }
00747     }
00748 
00749     /* Test the RIGHT edge of pixels in buffer, except corners */
00750     for (x= t-rw; x>rw; x-=rw) {
00751         // test if inner mask is filled
00752         if (limask[x]) {
00753             // test if inner mask is empty underneath or above
00754             if (!limask[x-rw] || !limask[x+rw]) {
00755                 isz++;                          // increment inner edge size
00756                 lres[x]=4;                      // flag pixel as inner edge
00757             }
00758             else {
00759                 res[x]=1.0f;                    // pixel is just part of inner mask, and it's not an edge
00760             }
00761         }
00762         else if (lomask[x]) {                       // inner mask was empty, test if outer mask is filled
00763             if (!lomask[x-rw] || !lomask[x+rw]) {   // test if outer mask is empty underneath or above
00764                 osz++;                              // increment outer edge size
00765                 lres[x]=3;                          // flag pixel as outer edge
00766             }
00767             else {
00768                 gsz++;                          // increment the gradient pixel count
00769                 lres[x]=2;                      // flag pixel as gradient
00770             }
00771         }
00772     }
00773 
00774     rsize[0]=isz;  // fill in our return sizes for edges + fill
00775     rsize[1]=osz;
00776     rsize[2]=gsz;
00777 }
00778 
00779 static void do_allEdgeDetection(unsigned int t, unsigned int rw, unsigned int *limask, unsigned int *lomask, unsigned int *lres, float *res, unsigned int *rsize, unsigned int in_isz, unsigned int in_osz, unsigned int in_gsz)
00780 {
00781     int x;                              // x = pixel loop counter
00782     int a;                              // a = pixel loop counter
00783     int dx;                             // dx = delta x
00784     int pix_prevRow;                    // pix_prevRow = pixel one row behind the one we are testing in a loop
00785     int pix_nextRow;                    // pix_nextRow = pixel one row in front of the one we are testing in a loop
00786     int pix_prevCol;                    // pix_prevCol = pixel one column behind the one we are testing in a loop
00787     int pix_nextCol;                    // pix_nextCol = pixel one column in front of the one we are testing in a loop
00788     /* Test all rows between the FIRST and LAST rows, excluding left and right edges */
00789     for (x= (t-rw)+1, dx=x-(rw-2); dx>rw; x-=rw,dx-=rw) {
00790         a=x-2;
00791         pix_prevRow=a+rw;
00792         pix_nextRow=a-rw;
00793         pix_prevCol=a+1;
00794         pix_nextCol=a-1;
00795         while (a>dx-2) {
00796             if (!limask[a]) {           // if the inner mask is empty
00797                 if (lomask[a]) {        // if the outer mask is full
00798                     /*
00799                      * Next we test all 4 directions around the current pixel: next/prev/up/down
00800                      * The test ensures that the outer mask is empty and that the inner mask
00801                      * is also empty. If both conditions are true for any one of the 4 adjacent pixels
00802                      * then the current pixel is counted as being a true outer edge pixel.
00803                      */
00804                     if ((!lomask[pix_nextCol] && !limask[pix_nextCol]) ||
00805                         (!lomask[pix_prevCol] && !limask[pix_prevCol]) ||
00806                         (!lomask[pix_nextRow] && !limask[pix_nextRow]) ||
00807                         (!lomask[pix_prevRow] && !limask[pix_prevRow]))
00808                     {
00809                         in_osz++;       // increment the outer boundary pixel count
00810                         lres[a]=3;      // flag pixel as part of outer edge
00811                     }
00812                     else {              // it's not a boundary pixel, but it is a gradient pixel
00813                         in_gsz++;       // increment the gradient pixel count
00814                         lres[a]=2;      // flag pixel as gradient
00815                     }
00816                 }
00817 
00818             }
00819             else {
00820                 if (!limask[pix_nextCol] || !limask[pix_prevCol] || !limask[pix_nextRow] || !limask[pix_prevRow]) {
00821                     in_isz++;           // increment the inner boundary pixel count
00822                     lres[a]=4;          // flag pixel as part of inner edge
00823                 }
00824                 else {
00825                     res[a]=1.0f;        // pixel is part of inner mask, but not at an edge
00826                 }
00827             }
00828             a--;
00829             pix_prevRow--;
00830             pix_nextRow--;
00831             pix_prevCol--;
00832             pix_nextCol--;
00833         }
00834     }
00835 
00836     rsize[0]=in_isz;  // fill in our return sizes for edges + fill
00837     rsize[1]=in_osz;
00838     rsize[2]=in_gsz;
00839 }
00840 
00841 static void do_adjacentEdgeDetection(unsigned int t, unsigned int rw, unsigned int *limask, unsigned int *lomask, unsigned int *lres, float *res, unsigned int *rsize, unsigned int in_isz, unsigned int in_osz, unsigned int in_gsz)
00842 {
00843     int x;                          // x = pixel loop counter
00844     int a;                          // a = pixel loop counter
00845     int dx;                         // dx = delta x
00846     int pix_prevRow;                // pix_prevRow = pixel one row behind the one we are testing in a loop
00847     int pix_nextRow;                // pix_nextRow = pixel one row in front of the one we are testing in a loop
00848     int pix_prevCol;                // pix_prevCol = pixel one column behind the one we are testing in a loop
00849     int pix_nextCol;                // pix_nextCol = pixel one column in front of the one we are testing in a loop
00850     /* Test all rows between the FIRST and LAST rows, excluding left and right edges */
00851     for (x= (t-rw)+1, dx=x-(rw-2); dx>rw; x-=rw,dx-=rw) {
00852         a=x-2;
00853         pix_prevRow=a+rw;
00854         pix_nextRow=a-rw;
00855         pix_prevCol=a+1;
00856         pix_nextCol=a-1;
00857         while (a>dx-2) {
00858             if (!limask[a]) {           // if the inner mask is empty
00859                 if (lomask[a]) {        // if the outer mask is full
00860                     /*
00861                      * Next we test all 4 directions around the current pixel: next/prev/up/down
00862                      * The test ensures that the outer mask is empty and that the inner mask
00863                      * is also empty. If both conditions are true for any one of the 4 adjacent pixels
00864                      * then the current pixel is counted as being a true outer edge pixel.
00865                      */
00866                     if ((!lomask[pix_nextCol] && !limask[pix_nextCol]) ||
00867                         (!lomask[pix_prevCol] && !limask[pix_prevCol]) ||
00868                         (!lomask[pix_nextRow] && !limask[pix_nextRow]) ||
00869                         (!lomask[pix_prevRow] && !limask[pix_prevRow]))
00870                     {
00871                         in_osz++;       // increment the outer boundary pixel count
00872                         lres[a]=3;      // flag pixel as part of outer edge
00873                     }
00874                     else {              // it's not a boundary pixel, but it is a gradient pixel
00875                         in_gsz++;       // increment the gradient pixel count
00876                         lres[a]=2;      // flag pixel as gradient
00877                     }
00878                 }
00879 
00880             }
00881             else {
00882                 if ((!limask[pix_nextCol] && lomask[pix_nextCol]) ||
00883                     (!limask[pix_prevCol] && lomask[pix_prevCol]) ||
00884                     (!limask[pix_nextRow] && lomask[pix_nextRow]) ||
00885                     (!limask[pix_prevRow] && lomask[pix_prevRow]))
00886                 {
00887                     in_isz++;           // increment the inner boundary pixel count
00888                     lres[a]=4;          // flag pixel as part of inner edge
00889                 }
00890                 else {
00891                     res[a]=1.0f;        // pixel is part of inner mask, but not at an edge
00892                 }
00893             }
00894             a--;
00895             pix_prevRow--;              // advance all four "surrounding" pixel pointers
00896             pix_nextRow--;
00897             pix_prevCol--;
00898             pix_nextCol--;
00899         }
00900     }
00901 
00902     rsize[0]=in_isz;  // fill in our return sizes for edges + fill
00903     rsize[1]=in_osz;
00904     rsize[2]=in_gsz;
00905 }
00906 
00907 static void do_createEdgeLocationBuffer(unsigned int t, unsigned int rw, unsigned int *lres, float *res, unsigned short *gbuf, unsigned int *innerEdgeOffset, unsigned int *outerEdgeOffset, unsigned int isz, unsigned int gsz)
00908 {
00909     int x;                          // x = pixel loop counter
00910     int a;                          // a = temporary pixel index buffer loop counter
00911     unsigned int ud;                // ud = unscaled edge distance
00912     unsigned int dmin;              // dmin = minimun edge distance
00913 
00914     unsigned int rsl;               // long used for finding fast 1.0/sqrt
00915     unsigned int gradientFillOffset;
00916     unsigned int innerAccum=0;      // for looping inner edge pixel indexes, represents current position from offset
00917     unsigned int outerAccum=0;      // for looping outer edge pixel indexes, represents current position from offset
00918     unsigned int gradientAccum=0;   // for looping gradient pixel indexes, represents current position from offset
00919     /*
00920      * Here we compute the size of buffer needed to hold (row,col) coordinates
00921      * for each pixel previously determined to be either gradient, inner edge,
00922      * or outer edge.
00923      *
00924      * Allocation is done by requesting 4 bytes "sizeof(int)" per pixel, even
00925      * though gbuf[] is declared as unsigned short* (2 bytes) because we don't
00926      * store the pixel indexes, we only store x,y location of pixel in buffer.
00927      *
00928      * This does make the assumption that x and y can fit in 16 unsigned bits
00929      * so if Blender starts doing renders greater than 65536 in either direction
00930      * this will need to allocate gbuf[] as unsigned int* and allocate 8 bytes
00931      * per flagged pixel.
00932      *
00933      * In general, the buffer on-screen:
00934      *
00935      * Example:  9 by 9 pixel block
00936      *
00937      * . = pixel non-white in both outer and inner mask
00938      * o = pixel white in outer, but not inner mask, adjacent to "." pixel
00939      * g = pixel white in outer, but not inner mask, not adjacent to "." pixel
00940      * i = pixel white in inner mask, adjacent to "g" or "." pixel
00941      * F = pixel white in inner mask, only adjacent to other pixels white in the inner mask
00942      *
00943      *
00944      *                  .........   <----- pixel #80
00945      *                  ..oooo...
00946      *                  .oggggo..
00947      *                  .oggiggo.
00948      *                  .ogiFigo.
00949      *                  .oggiggo.
00950      *                  .oggggo..
00951      *                  ..oooo...
00952      * pixel #00 -----> .........
00953      *
00954      * gsz = 18   (18 "g" pixels above)
00955      * isz = 4    (4 "i" pixels above)
00956      * osz = 18   (18 "o" pixels above)
00957      *
00958      *
00959      * The memory in gbuf[] after filling will look like this:
00960      *
00961      *  gradientFillOffset (0 pixels)                   innerEdgeOffset (18 pixels)    outerEdgeOffset (22 pixels)
00962      * /                                               /                              /
00963      * /                                               /                              /
00964      * |X   Y   X   Y   X   Y   X   Y   >     <X   Y   X   Y   >     <X   Y   X   Y   X   Y   >     <X   Y   X   Y   | <- (x,y)
00965      * +-------------------------------->     <---------------->     <------------------------>     <----------------+
00966      * |0   2   4   6   8   10  12  14  > ... <68  70  72  74  > ... <80  82  84  86  88  90  > ... <152 154 156 158 | <- bytes
00967      * +-------------------------------->     <---------------->     <------------------------>     <----------------+
00968      * |g0  g0  g1  g1  g2  g2  g3  g3  >     <g17 g17 i0  i0  >     <i2  i2  i3  i3  o0  o0  >     <o16 o16 o17 o17 | <- pixel
00969      *                                              /                              /                              /
00970      *                                             /                              /                              /
00971      *                                            /                              /                              /
00972      *   +---------- gradientAccum (18) ---------+      +--- innerAccum (22) ---+      +--- outerAccum (40) ---+
00973      *
00974      *
00975      * Ultimately we do need the pixel's memory buffer index to set the output
00976      * pixel color, but it's faster to reconstruct the memory buffer location
00977      * each iteration of the final gradient calculation than it is to deconstruct
00978      * a memory location into x,y pairs each round.
00979      */
00980 
00981 
00982     gradientFillOffset=0;                               // since there are likely "more" of these, put it first. :)
00983     *innerEdgeOffset=gradientFillOffset+gsz;            // set start of inner edge indexes
00984     *outerEdgeOffset=(*innerEdgeOffset)+isz;            // set start of outer edge indexes
00985     /* set the accumulators to correct positions */     // set up some accumulator variables for loops
00986     gradientAccum = gradientFillOffset;                 // each accumulator variable starts at its respective
00987     innerAccum = *innerEdgeOffset;                      // section's offset so when we start filling, each
00988     outerAccum = *outerEdgeOffset;                      // section fills up it's allocated space in gbuf
00989     //uses dmin=row, rsl=col
00990     for (x=0,dmin=0; x<t; x+=rw,dmin++) {
00991         for (rsl=0; rsl<rw; rsl++) {
00992             a=x+rsl;
00993             if (lres[a]==2) {           // it is a gradient pixel flagged by 2
00994                 ud=gradientAccum<<1;    // double the index to reach correct unsigned short location
00995                 gbuf[ud]=dmin;          // insert pixel's row into gradient pixel location buffer
00996                 gbuf[ud+1]=rsl;         // insert pixel's column into gradient pixel location buffer
00997                 gradientAccum++;        // increment gradient index buffer pointer
00998             }
00999             else if (lres[a]==3) {      // it is an outer edge pixel flagged by 3
01000                 ud=outerAccum<<1;       // double the index to reach correct unsigned short location
01001                 gbuf[ud]=dmin;          // insert pixel's row into outer edge pixel location buffer
01002                 gbuf[ud+1]=rsl;         // insert pixel's column into outer edge pixel location buffer
01003                 outerAccum++;           // increment outer edge index buffer pointer
01004                 res[a]=0.0f;            // set output pixel intensity now since it won't change later
01005             }
01006             else if (lres[a]==4) {      // it is an inner edge pixel flagged by 4
01007                 ud=innerAccum<<1;       // double int index to reach correct unsigned short location
01008                 gbuf[ud]=dmin;          // insert pixel's row into inner edge pixel location buffer
01009                 gbuf[ud+1]=rsl;         // insert pixel's column into inner edge pixel location buffer
01010                 innerAccum++;           // increment inner edge index buffer pointer
01011                 res[a]=1.0f;            // set output pixel intensity now since it won't change later
01012             }
01013         }
01014     }
01015 
01016 }
01017 
01018 static void do_fillGradientBuffer(unsigned int rw, float *res, unsigned short *gbuf, unsigned int isz, unsigned int osz, unsigned int gsz, unsigned int innerEdgeOffset, unsigned int outerEdgeOffset)
01019 {
01020     int x;                          // x = pixel loop counter
01021     int a;                          // a = temporary pixel index buffer loop counter
01022     int fsz;                        // size of the frame
01023     unsigned int rsl;               // long used for finding fast 1.0/sqrt
01024     float rsf;                      // float used for finding fast 1.0/sqrt
01025     const float rsopf = 1.5f;       // constant float used for finding fast 1.0/sqrt
01026 
01027     unsigned int gradientFillOffset;
01028     unsigned int t;
01029     unsigned int ud;                // ud = unscaled edge distance
01030     unsigned int dmin;              // dmin = minimun edge distance
01031     float odist;                    // odist = current outer edge distance
01032     float idist;                    // idist = current inner edge distance
01033     int dx;                         // dx = X-delta (used for distance proportion calculation)
01034     int dy;                         // dy = Y-delta (used for distance proportion calculation)
01035     /*
01036      * The general algorithm used to color each gradient pixel is:
01037      *
01038      * 1.) Loop through all gradient pixels.
01039      *    A.) For each gradient pixel:
01040      *        a.) Loop though all outside edge pixels, looking for closest one
01041      *            to the gradient pixel we are in.
01042      *        b.) Loop through all inside edge pixels, looking for closest one
01043      *            to the gradient pixel we are in.
01044      *        c.) Find proportion of distance from gradient pixel to inside edge
01045      *            pixel compared to sum of distance to inside edge and distance to
01046      *            outside edge.
01047      *
01048      *            In an image where:
01049      *            . = blank (black) pixels, not covered by inner mask or outer mask
01050      *            + = desired gradient pixels, covered only by outer mask
01051      *            * = white full mask pixels, covered by at least inner mask
01052      *
01053      *            ...............................
01054      *            ...............+++++++++++.....
01055      *            ...+O++++++..++++++++++++++....
01056      *            ..+++\++++++++++++++++++++.....
01057      *            .+++++G+++++++++*******+++.....
01058      *            .+++++|+++++++*********+++.....
01059      *            .++***I****************+++.....
01060      *            .++*******************+++......
01061      *            .+++*****************+++.......
01062      *            ..+++***************+++........
01063      *            ....+++**********+++...........
01064      *            ......++++++++++++.............
01065      *            ...............................
01066      *
01067      *                O = outside edge pixel
01068      *                 \
01069      *                  G = gradient pixel
01070      *                  |
01071      *                  I = inside edge pixel
01072      *
01073      *                             __
01074      *                  *note that IO does not need to be a straight line, in fact
01075      *                   many cases can arise where straight lines do not work
01076      *                   correctly.
01077      *
01078      *                                        __       __     __
01079      *        d.) Pixel color is assigned as |GO| / ( |GI| + |GO| )
01080      *
01081      * The implementation does not compute distance, but the reciprocal of the
01082      * distance. This is done to avoid having to compute a square root, as a
01083      * reciprocal square root can be computed faster. Therefore, the code computes
01084      * pixel color as |GI| / (|GI| + |GO|). Since these are reciprocals, GI serves the
01085      * purpose of GO for the proportion calculation.
01086      *
01087      * For the purposes of the minimun distance comparisons, we only check
01088      * the sums-of-squares against each other, since they are in the same
01089      * mathematical sort-order as if we did go ahead and take square roots
01090      *
01091      * Loop through all gradient pixels.
01092      */
01093 
01094     for (x= gsz-1; x>=0; x--) {
01095         gradientFillOffset=x<<1;
01096         t=gbuf[gradientFillOffset];     // calculate column of pixel indexed by gbuf[x]
01097         fsz=gbuf[gradientFillOffset+1]; // calculate row of pixel indexed by gbuf[x]
01098         dmin=0xffffffff;                    // reset min distance to edge pixel
01099         for (a=outerEdgeOffset+osz-1; a>=outerEdgeOffset; a--) {    // loop through all outer edge buffer pixels
01100             ud=a<<1;
01101             dy=t-gbuf[ud];                  // set dx to gradient pixel column - outer edge pixel row
01102             dx=fsz-gbuf[ud+1];              // set dy to gradient pixel row - outer edge pixel column
01103             ud=dx*dx+dy*dy;                 // compute sum of squares
01104             if (ud<dmin) {                  // if our new sum of squares is less than the current minimum
01105                 dmin=ud;                    // set a new minimum equal to the new lower value
01106             }
01107         }
01108         odist=(float)(dmin);                    // cast outer min to a float
01109         rsf=odist*0.5f;                         //
01110         rsl=*(unsigned int*)&odist;             // use some peculiar properties of the way bits are stored
01111         rsl=0x5f3759df-(rsl>>1);                // in floats vs. unsigned ints to compute an approximate
01112         odist=*(float*)&rsl;                    // reciprocal square root
01113         odist=odist*(rsopf-(rsf*odist*odist));  // -- ** this line can be iterated for more accuracy ** --
01114         dmin=0xffffffff;                        // reset min distance to edge pixel
01115         for (a= innerEdgeOffset+isz-1; a>=innerEdgeOffset; a--) {   // loop through all inside edge pixels
01116             ud=a<<1;
01117             dy=t-gbuf[ud];          // compute delta in Y from gradient pixel to inside edge pixel
01118             dx=fsz-gbuf[ud+1];      // compute delta in X from gradient pixel to inside edge pixel
01119             ud=dx*dx+dy*dy;         // compute sum of squares
01120             if (ud<dmin) {          // if our new sum of squares is less than the current minimum we've found
01121                 dmin=ud;            // set a new minimum equal to the new lower value
01122             }
01123         }
01124         idist=(float)(dmin);                    // cast inner min to a float
01125         rsf=idist*0.5f;                         //
01126         rsl=*(unsigned int*)&idist;             //
01127         rsl=0x5f3759df-(rsl>>1);                // see notes above
01128         idist=*(float*)&rsl;                    //
01129         idist=idist*(rsopf-(rsf*idist*idist));  //
01130         /*
01131          * Note once again that since we are using reciprocals of distance values our
01132          * proportion is already the correct intensity, and does not need to be
01133          * subracted from 1.0 like it would have if we used real distances.
01134          */
01135 
01136         /*
01137          * Here we reconstruct the pixel's memory location in the CompBuf by
01138          * Pixel Index = Pixel Column + ( Pixel Row * Row Width )
01139          */
01140         res[gbuf[gradientFillOffset+1]+(gbuf[gradientFillOffset]*rw)]=(idist/(idist+odist));    //set intensity
01141     }
01142 
01143 }
01144 
01145 
01146 static void node_composit_exec_doubleedgemask(void *UNUSED(data), bNode *node, bNodeStack **in, bNodeStack **out)
01147 {
01148 
01149     float *imask;                   // imask = pointer to inner mask pixel buffer
01150     float *omask;                   // omask = pointer to outer mask pixel buffer
01151     float *res;                     // res = pointer to output mask
01152 
01153     unsigned int *lres;             // lres = unsigned int pointer to output pixel buffer (for bit operations)
01154     unsigned int *limask;           // limask = unsigned int pointer to inner mask (for bit operations)
01155     unsigned int *lomask;           // lomask = unsigned int pointer to outer mask (for bit operations)
01156 
01157     int rw;                         // rw = pixel row width
01158     int t;                          // t = total number of pixels in buffer - 1 (used for loop starts)
01159     int fsz;                        // size of the frame
01160 
01161     unsigned int isz=0;             // size (in pixels) of inside edge pixel index buffer
01162     unsigned int osz=0;             // size (in pixels) of outside edge pixel index buffer
01163     unsigned int gsz=0;             // size (in pixels) of gradient pixel index buffer
01164     unsigned int rsize[3];          // size storage to pass to helper functions
01165     unsigned int innerEdgeOffset=0; // offset into final buffer where inner edge pixel indexes start
01166     unsigned int outerEdgeOffset=0; // offset into final buffer where outer edge pixel indexes start
01167 
01168     unsigned short *gbuf;           // gradient/inner/outer pixel location index buffer
01169 
01170     CompBuf *cbuf;                  // pointer, will be set to inner mask data
01171     CompBuf *dbuf;                  // pointer, will be set to outer mask data
01172     CompBuf *stackbuf;              // pointer, will get allocated as output buffer
01173 
01174     if (out[0]->hasoutput==0) {     // if the node's output socket is not connected to anything...
01175         return;                     //     do not execute any further, just exit the node immediately
01176     }
01177 
01178     if (in[0]->data && in[1]->data) {                   // if both input sockets have some data coming in...
01179         cbuf= in[0]->data;                              //     get a pointer to the inner mask data
01180         dbuf= in[1]->data;                              //     get a pointer to the outer mask data
01181         if (cbuf->type!=CB_VAL || dbuf->type!=CB_VAL) { // if either input socket has an incorrect data type coming in
01182             return;                                     //     exit the node immediately
01183         }
01184 
01185         t=(cbuf->x*cbuf->y)-1;                                  // determine size of the frame
01186 
01187         stackbuf= alloc_compbuf(cbuf->x, cbuf->y, CB_VAL, 1);   // allocate the output buffer
01188 
01189         imask= cbuf->rect;              // set the inner mask
01190         omask= dbuf->rect;              // set the outer mask
01191         res= stackbuf->rect;            // set output pointer
01192         lres= (unsigned int*)res;       // unsigned int pointer to output buffer (for bit level ops)
01193         limask=(unsigned int*)imask;    // unsigned int pointer to input mask (for bit level ops)
01194         lomask=(unsigned int*)omask;    // unsigned int pointer to output mask (for bit level ops)
01195         rw= cbuf->x;                    // width of a row of pixels
01196 
01197 
01198         /*
01199          * The whole buffer is broken up into 4 parts. The four CORNERS, the FIRST and LAST rows, the
01200          * LEFT and RIGHT edges (excluding the corner pixels), and all OTHER rows.
01201          * This allows for quick computation of outer edge pixels where
01202          * a screen edge pixel is marked to be gradient.
01203          *
01204          * The pixel type (gradient vs inner-edge vs outer-edge) tests change
01205          * depending on the user selected "Inner Edge Mode" and the user selected
01206          * "Buffer Edge Mode" on the node's GUI. There are 4 sets of basically the
01207          * same algorithm:
01208          *
01209          * 1.) Inner Edge -> Adjacent Only
01210          *     Buffer Edge -> Keep Inside
01211          *
01212          * 2.) Inner Edge -> Adjacent Only
01213          *     Buffer Edge -> Bleed Out
01214          *
01215          * 3.) Inner Edge -> All
01216          *     Buffer Edge -> Keep Inside
01217          *
01218          * 4.) Inner Edge -> All
01219          *     Buffer Edge -> Bleed Out
01220          *
01221          * Each version has slightly different criteria for detecting an edge pixel.
01222          */
01223         if (node->custom2) {        // if "adjacent only" inner edge mode is turned on
01224             if (node->custom1) {    // if "keep inside" buffer edge mode is turned on
01225                 do_adjacentKeepBorders(t,rw,limask,lomask,lres,res,rsize);
01226             }
01227             else {                  // "bleed out" buffer edge mode is turned on
01228                 do_adjacentBleedBorders(t,rw,limask,lomask,lres,res,rsize);
01229             }
01230             isz=rsize[0];           // set up inner edge, outer edge, and gradient buffer sizes after border pass
01231             osz=rsize[1];
01232             gsz=rsize[2];
01233             // detect edges in all non-border pixels in the buffer
01234             do_adjacentEdgeDetection(t,rw,limask,lomask,lres,res,rsize,isz,osz,gsz);
01235         }
01236         else {                      // "all" inner edge mode is turned on
01237             if (node->custom1) {    // if "keep inside" buffer edge mode is turned on
01238                 do_allKeepBorders(t,rw,limask,lomask,lres,res,rsize);
01239             }
01240             else {                  // "bleed out" buffer edge mode is turned on
01241                 do_allBleedBorders(t,rw,limask,lomask,lres,res,rsize);
01242             }
01243             isz=rsize[0];           // set up inner edge, outer edge, and gradient buffer sizes after border pass
01244             osz=rsize[1];
01245             gsz=rsize[2];
01246             // detect edges in all non-border pixels in the buffer
01247             do_allEdgeDetection(t,rw,limask,lomask,lres,res,rsize,isz,osz,gsz);
01248         }
01249 
01250         isz=rsize[0];               // set edge and gradient buffer sizes once again...
01251         osz=rsize[1];               // the sizes in rsize[] may have been modified
01252         gsz=rsize[2];               // by the do_*EdgeDetection() function.
01253 
01254         // quick check for existance of edges in the buffer...
01255         // if we don't have any one of the three sizes, the other two make no difference visually,
01256         // so we can just pass the inner input buffer back as output.
01257         if (!gsz || !isz || !osz) {
01258             out[0]->data= stackbuf; // point the node output buffer to our filled buffer
01259             return;
01260         }
01261 
01262 
01263         fsz=gsz+isz+osz;                                    // calculate size of pixel index buffer needed
01264         gbuf= MEM_mallocN(fsz*sizeof(int), "grd buf");      // allocate edge/gradient pixel index buffer
01265 
01266         do_createEdgeLocationBuffer(t,rw,lres,res,gbuf,&innerEdgeOffset,&outerEdgeOffset,isz,gsz);
01267         do_fillGradientBuffer(rw,res,gbuf,isz,osz,gsz,innerEdgeOffset,outerEdgeOffset);
01268 
01269         MEM_freeN(gbuf);        // free the gradient index buffer
01270         out[0]->data= stackbuf; // point the node output buffer to our filled buffer
01271     }
01272 }
01273 
01274 void register_node_type_cmp_doubleedgemask(bNodeTreeType *ttype)
01275 {
01276     static bNodeType ntype; // allocate a node type data structure
01277 
01278     node_type_base(ttype, &ntype, CMP_NODE_DOUBLEEDGEMASK, "Double Edge Mask", NODE_CLASS_MATTE, NODE_OPTIONS);
01279     node_type_socket_templates(&ntype, cmp_node_doubleedgemask_in, cmp_node_doubleedgemask_out);
01280     node_type_size(&ntype, 210, 210, 210);
01281     node_type_exec(&ntype, node_composit_exec_doubleedgemask);
01282 
01283     nodeRegisterType(ttype, &ntype);
01284 }
